metadata.title: The Awakening
metadata.subtitle: Midnight Nation – Module 01
metadata.setting: Post-WWII American city (Chicago, St. Louis, Baltimore, Detroit)

overview.synopsis: Something ancient has stirred beneath the city—whispers in sewers, dead radios crackling with voices, and people vanishing without a trace. At the same time, the player characters experience their first supernatural awakening: abilities, instincts, visions, or compulsions tied to their Bloodline.
overview.premise: The PCs become the spark point where three powerful factions collide, each with their own agenda regarding the supernatural awakening sweeping through the city.
overview.tagline: When the sleeping powers awaken, whose side will you choose?

factions.name: Ashwood Foundation
factions.agenda: Hunt & contain supernatural threats. Believe PCs are part of the outbreak.
factions.approach: Militant, pragmatic, treat supernaturals as threats to be neutralized
factions.resources: Military-grade weapons, containment facilities, extensive intelligence network
factions.recruitment_pitch: Help us protect humanity from the darkness. You've seen what's out there—join us before you become it.

factions.name: Covenant of St. Michael
factions.agenda: Attempt to 'purify' the awakening—may see PCs as chosen or cursed.
factions.approach: Zealous faith, exorcisms, holy relics, see everything through religious lens
factions.resources: Consecrated weapons, holy sanctuaries, ancient texts, church backing
factions.recruitment_pitch: You are touched by powers beyond mortal understanding. We can help you master them—or cleanse them if needed.

factions.name: The Black Chamber
factions.agenda: U.S. intelligence wants to weaponize awakening phenomena for covert ops.
factions.approach: Cold War pragmatism, see supernaturals as assets or Soviet threats
factions.resources: Government authority, cutting-edge technology, unlimited budget
factions.recruitment_pitch: The Soviets are already weaponizing the supernatural. Help us level the playing field. Your country needs you.

sessions.title: The Stirring
sessions.summary: The PCs investigate a brutal murder that defies explanation while experiencing their own supernatural awakening.

hooks.title: The Veteran
hooks.description: A decorated war veteran found mutilated in an alley, no blood left in body. One of the PCs knew him from the war or the neighborhood.

hooks.title: The Return
hooks.description: A missing person known to the PCs resurfaces possessed or altered. They seek out the PCs specifically, as if drawn by instinct.

hooks.title: The Vision
hooks.description: The PCs are drawn to a strange incident site by visions, dreams, or unexplainable compulsions. They arrive separately but are all pulled to the same location.

scenes.title: Scene 1: The Crime Scene
scenes.location: Dark alley behind a jazz club, rain-slicked cobblestones
scenes.atmosphere: Cigarette smoke mingles with iron-scent of blood. Neon signs flicker. Police tape cordons off the area. Detective's trench coat drips with rain.
scenes.description: The ground is scorched in hand-shaped patterns. Witnesses recall a pale figure fleeing the scene. The body is twisted in an unnatural position, face frozen in terror.

clues.success: Demonic thermal residue. Whatever made this handprint radiates infernal heat.
clues.failure: Strange burns, possibly accelerant or electrical.

clues.success: Digitigrade (animal-like) prints. Barefoot, clawed, approximately human-sized.
clues.failure: Disturbed mud and refuse, nothing clear.

clues.success: Ashed human flesh mixed with sulfuric compounds. Not dirt—this is what remains when a demon feeds.
clues.failure: Soot or ash, possibly from a fire.

clues.success: Drunk at nearby bar saw 'something wrong with its legs' running away. Moved too fast to be human.
clues.failure: Witnesses clam up or give contradictory accounts.

npcs_present.name: Detective Lou Ferraro
npcs_present.description: Worn-down cop, two years from retirement, seen too much already
npcs_present.attitude: Skeptical but shaken. 'Just keep civilians out of my crime scene.'
npcs_present.knowledge: This is the third killing this month with similar MO

scenes.title: Scene 2: The Awakening
scenes.description: Each PC experiences a sudden, overwhelming supernatural manifestation tied to their bloodline. This is terrifying, exhilarating, and undeniable.

bloodline_triggers.trigger: Smell blood → hunger overwhelms briefly. Fangs ache. Victim's spilled blood smells intoxicating.
bloodline_triggers.mechanical_effect: Gain Bloodline Level 1 Passive + Power. Must roll Soul (DC 8) to avoid compulsion to taste blood.

bloodline_triggers.trigger: Hear distant howling no one else hears. Feel pack bonds forming with other PCs. Nails sharpen momentarily.
bloodline_triggers.mechanical_effect: Gain enhanced senses. +1 die to Tracking. Can sense other supernatural beings within 30 feet.

bloodline_triggers.trigger: Soft radiance lights the scene. Demon's residue burns your skin. You feel righteous fury rising.
bloodline_triggers.mechanical_effect: Gain divine sense. Can detect evil intent. Holy symbols glow faintly in your presence.

bloodline_triggers.trigger: Psychic ripple as victim died—you feel their final terror. Nearby objects rattle. Lights flicker.
bloodline_triggers.mechanical_effect: Gain telepathic sensitivity. Can read surface thoughts (Soul check). Objects move involuntarily when emotional.

bloodline_triggers.trigger: See the victim's ghost lingering at the scene. They point toward the sewers, mouthing 'below.'
bloodline_triggers.mechanical_effect: Gain death sight. See ghosts and spiritual residue. Immune to fear from undead.

scenes.gm_guidance: Play this moment as both frightening and empowering. The PCs should feel out of control but also awakened to hidden potential. Allow players to describe how it feels. This is their origin story.

scenes.title: Scene 3: First Blood (Optional Combat)
scenes.trigger: If PCs linger or investigate too thoroughly, entity returns
scenes.description: Temperature drops. Lights flicker. Witnesses flee. A Lesser Shade materializes from the alley wall.

enemy.name: Lesser Shade
enemy.tactics: Phase through walls to attack from behind. Target the weakest-looking PC. Flee if reduced to 1 wound.
enemy.motivation: Eliminate witnesses to the demon's feeding

scenes.environment: Alley, confined space, poor lighting. Dumpsters provide cover. Fire escape ladder leads to rooftops.
scenes.outcome_success: Shade dissipates with an echoing wail. Leaves behind ectoplasmic residue that points toward the sewers.
scenes.outcome_failure: Shade escapes through wall. PCs hear it whispering their names as it flees.

session_end.cliffhanger: A manhole cover nearby is slightly ajar. Steam rises from below. Scratching sounds echo from the depths. A child's voice calls for help from the darkness.
session_end.advancement: PCs should reach Level 1 by end of session if starting at 0

sessions.title: Shadows in the Sewers
sessions.summary: The PCs descend into the city's underworld, discovering a cult's ritual site and facing horrors in the dark.
sessions.opening: News reports: three sewer workers missing. Police seal off access points. PCs have leads pointing underground. Strange symbols appear spray-painted near manhole covers.

scenes.title: Scene 1: Descent
scenes.description: Rusted ladder descends into darkness. Water rushes below. Walls sweat with condensation. Radio signals die as you descend.

skill_challenges.success: Find direct route to ritual chamber. Avoid patrols.
skill_challenges.failure: Get lost. Encounter extra cultist patrol. Waste time.

skill_challenges.success: Symbols form a summoning circle. Ritual requires human sacrifice and is nearly complete.
skill_challenges.failure: Symbols seem random. Ominous but unintelligible.

skill_challenges.success: Observe cult activities unnoticed. Gather intel.
skill_challenges.failure: Alert cultists or Ashwood patrol. Combat inevitable.

discoveries: Walls etched with occult runes in reverse Latin: 'Wake the Sleepers'
Piles of bones dissolved by acid, not chewed—something chemical or supernatural
Industrial maintenance tunnels converted into makeshift temple
Ashwood Foundation agents in hazmat suits taking samples

scenes.title: Scene 2: The Feeding Ground
scenes.atmosphere: Unnatural heat. Smell of sulfur and rot. Dripping water echoes. Shadows move wrong.
scenes.description: Three humanoid figures crouch over corpses, feeding. Their skin is gray and mottled. Claws scrape concrete. They sense the PCs and turn—faces elongated, hollow-eyed, mouths too wide.

enemies.name: Corpse-Feeder Daemon
enemies.tactics: Climb walls. Surround PCs. Focus fire on isolated targets. Flee if outnumbered.

combat_encounter.terrain: Water slows movement. Pipes provide cover. Low ceiling prevents some maneuvers.
complications: Blood in water attracts more creatures

loot: Daemon claw (can be used as weapon, d6 damage)
Half-dissolved ID badge from missing worker

scenes.title: Scene 3: The Ritual Chamber
scenes.location: Converted pump station, 40 feet in diameter
scenes.description: Massive circular chamber. Symbols painted in blood. Central altar made of stacked bones. Candles flicker despite no wind. Four cult fanatics chant in unison.

npcs_present.name: Cult Leader (unnamed for now)
npcs_present.description: Robed figure, face hidden, voice echoing
npcs_present.dialogue: 'The Awakening cannot be stopped. The sleepers rise. Join us or be consumed.'
npcs_present.knowledge: Knows about PCs' bloodlines. Offers corruption.

choices.consequence: Combat with 4 cult fanatics. Ritual partially disrupted but not stopped.
Learn ritual's full scope. Gain +2 dice to stop it in Session 5.
Cultist offers knowledge in exchange for blood or favor. Moral compromise.

session_end.cliffhanger: Ashwood Foundation flashbangs explode. Armed team breaches chamber. Leader: 'On the ground! You're all under arrest!' Cultists scatter. Daemons shriek and flee into darkness.

sessions.title: Blood in the Water
sessions.summary: The PCs face the true threat behind the killings and learn the ritual's horrifying purpose.
sessions.opening: PCs escape Ashwood or are detained briefly. Cult activity escalates. Bodies pile up. Media blackout begins. PCs receive visions or messages urging them to finish what they started.

scenes.title: Scene 1: Faction Pressure
scenes.description: Each faction makes contact, offering resources in exchange for cooperation.

faction_encounters.approach: Tactical briefing. 'We have satellite intel showing ritual convergence points. Work with us or get out of the way.'
faction_encounters.offer: Military-grade silver ammunition, body armor, tactical support

faction_encounters.approach: Spiritual counsel. 'Your souls are in danger. Accept our blessing or face damnation.'
Cold pragmatism. 'We've been tracking this cell for months. You're now assets or obstacles.'
faction_encounters.offer: Classified intel, government authority, extraction if things go wrong

scenes.decision_point: PCs can accept help from one faction, attempt independence, or play factions against each other.

scenes.title: Scene 2: The Daemon's Lair
scenes.atmosphere: Fog rolls off black water. Rusted metal groans. Distant foghorn. Building interior lit by ritual candles.
scenes.description: The Lesser Daemon—larger than the feeders, standing eight feet tall—tends to a grotesque altar of corpses. It's intelligent, calculating. It knows the PCs are coming.

enemy.name: Lesser Daemon (Enhanced Corpse-Feeder)
abilities: Summon Flies: Creates obscuring cloud, -2 dice to attacks
Rapid Regeneration: Heals 1 wound per turn unless damaged by silver/holy
Terror Aura: All PCs must roll Soul (DC 10) or suffer -1 die for encounter
enemy.tactics: Use environment. Summon minions. Try to separate and isolate PCs. Monologue about the coming awakening.

features: Catwalk above (requires climbing, provides height advantage)
Chemical barrels (can be ignited for area damage)
Loading dock door (escape route or call for backup)

mid_combat_twist.event: Daemon reveals truth: 'I am not the architect! The ritual will proceed with or without me! Your awakening is the key!'
mid_combat_twist.revelation: The daemon is a pawn. The real threat is the mass awakening event.

scenes.title: Scene 3: Aftermath and Revelation
scenes.description: Daemon banished or killed. Cult scattered. But ritual components point to something larger—a citywide event planned for the new moon (3 days away).
evidence_found: Map showing 13 ritual sites across the city
List of names—other awakened individuals being hunted or recruited
Calendar marked: NEW MOON - THE GREAT AWAKENING

npc_reaction.covenant: Mass exorcism planned. May harm innocents.
npc_reaction.black_chamber: Extraction teams mobilize. May weaponize awakened individuals.

session_end.cliffhanger: PCs' bloodlines flare violently. They feel others like them awakening across the city. A psychic scream echoes: 'Come to us. Join the Awakening. Or burn with the old world.'

sessions.title: Factions Collide
sessions.summary: With the final ritual approaching, PCs must choose sides or forge their own path.
sessions.opening: City in chaos. Disappearances spike. News reports 'mass hysteria.' Military vehicles patrol streets. Churches hold emergency vigils. PCs are contacted by all three factions simultaneously.

scenes.title: Scene 1: The Offers
scenes.structure: Three separate meetings, players choose order

meetings.pitch: We're deploying containment teams at all 13 sites. You're insiders—awakened but still human. Help us identify targets before they become threats.
meetings.mission: Infiltrate final ritual. Tag key individuals for capture. Prevent mass awakening.
meetings.reward: Military contracts, steady income, protection from other factions
meetings.consequence: Become hunters of your own kind. Morally grey at best.

meetings.pitch: The awakening is a test of faith. Some will be sanctified, others damned. We can guide you toward salvation—and help others find it too.
meetings.mission: Consecrate ritual sites. Offer awakened individuals redemption or purification.
meetings.reward: Holy weapons, spiritual protection, sanctuary network

meetings.pitch: The Soviets have their own program—Operation Red Star. We need assets to counter them. You're patriots, aren't you?
meetings.mission: Hijack the ritual. Redirect awakening energy into controlled subjects (PCs included).
meetings.reward: Government backing, classified tech, license to operate
meetings.consequence: Become government weapons. Cold War escalation.

scenes.title: Scene 2: The Fourth Option
scenes.trigger: If PCs reject all three factions or show hesitation
scenes.description: A mysterious figure contacts PCs—another awakened individual, neither faction-aligned. Offers an alternative.

npc.name: Elias Thorne
npc.description: Older man, refined, knowing eyes. Awakened decades ago.
npc.background: Former Black Chamber asset who went rogue. Knows the truth about all three factions.
npc.pitch: They all want to control you. I'm offering freedom. Stop the ritual on YOUR terms. Become the balance between humanity and the supernatural.
npc.offer: Hidden safehouse network, ancient texts, independence

scenes.revelation: Elias reveals: The Architect is experimenting with forced awakenings. Natural awakening is rare and personal—this ritual is mass-production, and most subjects won't survive.

scenes.title: Scene 3: Preparation Montage
scenes.structure: Players describe how PCs spend final day before ritual
options: Set up ambushes or countermeasures at ritual sites
scenes.gm_guidance: Give each PC a spotlight moment. Build tension. Let them roll prep checks that give bonuses in finale.

session_end.cliffhanger: New moon rises. City lights flicker. Psychic pulse ripples outward. All 13 ritual sites activate simultaneously. PCs feel the pull—they MUST go to the central site. It's not a choice. The Architect awaits.

sessions.title: The Ritual
sessions.summary: The PCs confront the Architect and decide the fate of the awakening—and possibly the entire supernatural community.
sessions.opening: New moon. Waterfront industrial complex. Thirteen ritual circles glow across the city. At the center: an ancient, powerful entity channeling awakening energy.

scenes.title: Scene 1: Approach
scenes.description: Ritual in progress. Hundreds of people—willing and unwilling—stand in concentric circles, chanting. Reality warps. Sky tears open. Faction forces converge from all sides.

complications.effect: Gunfire. Chaos. Innocents caught in crossfire.
Psychic backlash. Some awakened individuals die instantly.
EMP pulse. Magic and technology both disrupted.

scenes.title: Scene 2: The Architect Revealed
scenes.description: At ritual's heart stands the Architect—a figure in black robes, face obscured. Voice resonates with power.

villain.name: The Architect (Dr. Solomon Grey)
villain.background: Occult researcher who witnessed atomic bomb tests. Believes supernatural power is the next stage of human evolution. Willing to sacrifice thousands to force it.
villain.motivation: Create a new world order where awakened rule openly
villain.appearance: Scholarly, middle-aged, burn scars from failed ritual decades ago
villain.powers: Master ritualist, can channel others' powers, psychically dominate weak-willed

scenes.dialogue: You feel it, don't you? The old world is dying. Hiroshima, Nagasaki—humanity proved it can destroy itself. But WE... we can transcend. Join me. Rule the new age.

choice_point.join: Architect offers PCs positions of power. Ritual succeeds but PCs become villains.
choice_point.refuse: Boss fight begins. Architect + elite guards.
choice_point.hijack: Redirect ritual energy (Occult DC 15). Risky but empowering.

enemy.name: Dr. Solomon Grey (The Architect)
abilities: Channel Ritual: Absorb power from nearby awakened. Heals 2 wounds per turn.
Dominate Mind: Force Soul check (DC 12) or ally turns hostile for 1d3 rounds.
Reality Tear: AOE attack, 2d10 damage to all in 20ft radius.
Phase Shift: Can't be targeted by mundane weapons while channeling.
weaknesses: Disrupting ritual circle (-3 dice to all actions)
Attacks from other awakened ignore phase shift

minions.name: Dominated Awakened
minions.note: Can be freed with Soul checks

battlefield.environmental_hazard: Reality instability. Each turn, roll d6: 1-2 = gravity shifts, 3-4 = time hiccup, 5-6 = psychic scream (Soul check)

outcomes.result: Awakening prevented. Status quo maintained. PCs remain rare anomalies. Factions grateful but wary.
outcomes.campaign_impact: PCs become hidden protectors. Low supernatural activity.

outcomes.result: Mass awakening. Chaos. Thousands die or go mad. Survivors form new supernatural community. World changes forever.
outcomes.campaign_impact: Urban fantasy setting. Factions war openly. High-stakes politics.

outcomes.result: PCs absorb power surge. Become significantly more powerful. Smaller-scale awakening. PCs responsible for guiding new awakened.
outcomes.campaign_impact: PCs as mentors/leaders. Balanced supernatural presence.

outcomes.result: Ashwood/Covenant/Black Chamber weaponizes ritual. PCs become agents/assets. Moral compromise.
outcomes.campaign_impact: Factional campaign. Espionage and covert ops focus.

epilogue.text: The new moon sets. Dawn breaks over the city. Smoke rises from the waterfront. Emergency crews respond. News anchors struggle to explain the night's events. The PCs stand amid the aftermath, forever changed. The Awakening—controlled, chaotic, or prevented—has passed. But its echoes will shape everything that follows. Welcome to Midnight Nation.
final_rewards: Faction standing (ally or enemy status locked in)
Reputation: The PCs are now known in supernatural circles

npcs.name: Detective Henry Marlowe
npcs.description: A weathered detective in his late 40s with tired eyes that have seen too much. Wears a rumpled trench coat and chain-smokes Lucky Strikes. His badge is tarnished but his resolve isn't.
npcs.personality: Pragmatic and world-weary. Knows the supernatural is real but keeps it buried under paperwork and whiskey. Protects civilians first, asks questions later. Has a soft spot for those trying to make amends.
npcs.motivation: Solve the murders, protect civilians, suppress panic.
secrets: He knows supernatural activity is real but won't admit it openly.
Mallory was under his protection as part of an unofficial rehab program.
plot_hooks: Warns players about Ashwood agents operating in the precinct.
Provides sealed police files in exchange for results.
quotes: I've seen three 'impossible' murders this month. At a certain point, impossible becomes Tuesday.
Whatever you are, whatever you're into—I don't care. Just don't leave bodies in my district.
Mallory was a good man trying to get straight. He didn't deserve what happened.

npcs.name: Sister Aurelia Valente
npcs.description: A striking woman in her early 30s who wears a modified nun's habit with tactical boots. Italian accent. Carries a rosary in one hand and concealed blessed silver in the other. Burn scars mar her left arm from a failed exorcism.
npcs.personality: Zealous but not unkind. Believes redemption is possible even for the damned, but preparation for the alternative is essential. Speaks of damnation and salvation with equal certainty.
npcs.motivation: Cleanse supernatural incursions without allowing government intervention.

combat_stats.special: Can perform exorcism rituals. Holy symbols deal extra damage to supernatural creatures.

secrets: She believes one of the PCs may be a prophesied 'Reconciler.'
She is hiding a demonic sigil carved into her shoulder—a mark from her failed exorcism.
plot_hooks: Offers to sanctify weapons in exchange for information.
Will forcibly exorcise a PC if their bloodline becomes obvious.
quotes: God's grace is infinite, but His patience is not. Choose wisely.
I have faced demons in the flesh. What are you compared to that?
The darkness calls to you. I can help you resist—or I can end you before you fall.

npcs.name: Agent Silas Mercer
npcs.description: Mid-30s with a forgettable face—exactly as trained. Always wears dark suits and carries an earpiece. Former OSS operative who transitioned to 'specialized operations' after the war. Knows more than he reveals.
npcs.personality: Cold War pragmatist through and through. Views everything as either an asset or a threat. Not cruel, just clinical. Will make the hard calls without hesitation because someone has to.
npcs.motivation: Contain supernatural forces and weaponize them for covert operations.

combat_stats.special: Can call in Black Chamber backup teams. Has access to experimental occult technology.

secrets: He knows about Project MK-Harrow, a ritual superweapon initiative.
He may recruit or abduct a PC depending on their behavior and usefulness.
plot_hooks: Offers classified documents in exchange for cooperation.
Sends agents to shadow or detain PCs if they interfere with operations.
quotes: The Soviets have three operational psychic divisions. We're playing catch-up.
I don't need you to like me. I need you to not be a liability.
Patriotism isn't about flags—it's about making choices civilians never have to know about.

npcs.name: Jonas Vell
npcs.faction: Independent Occult Cell (unknowingly feeding The Black Chamber)
npcs.description: A charismatic man in his late 40s with intense eyes that seem to glow amber in dim light. Wears expensive suits beneath ritual robes. Speaks with the calm certainty of a true believer. Ritual scars cover his arms.
npcs.personality: Visionary zealot who believes he's saving humanity by forcing supernatural evolution. Not sadistic—clinical. Sees casualties as necessary sacrifices. Genuinely believes the PCs should thank him for awakening them.
npcs.motivation: Awaken latent bloodlines across the city to trigger a new occult age.
npcs.backstory: Former academic obsessed with occult history. Witnessed something during the war that shattered his worldview. Spent decades researching forbidden rituals. Believes daemon pacts are the key to human transcendence.

combat_stats.special: Can channel power from awakened individuals. Each awakened within 30 feet adds +1 die to his ritual pools. Can summon lesser daemons as combat actions.

secrets: He believes a greater daemon can grant true immortality.
His rituals are being monitored by The Black Chamber without his knowledge.
He was the one who marked Mallory before death, attempting to use him as a ritual anchor.
plot_hooks: PCs may find his ritual notes and attempt to mimic or counter his work.
He will attempt to recruit awakened PCs, offering power and purpose.
He escapes the final encounter if not killed, setting up future conflicts.
quotes: You feel it, don't you? The power awakening in your blood. I can teach you to embrace it.
They called Oppenheimer a monster for unleashing the atom. History will vindicate us both.
Humanity's next evolution begins with blood and fire. Join me, or be left behind.

npcs.name: Francis 'Frank' Mallory
npcs.description: DECEASED. A Korean War veteran in his early 30s who was trying to rebuild his life. Worked as a mechanic. Had kind eyes despite the things he'd seen. His body was found mutilated in an alley—the first victim.
npcs.personality: Was a good man trying to leave violence behind. Haunted by war but determined to help others avoid his fate. Discovered the cult and tried to stop them alone.
npcs.motivation: Was trying to stop the cult before death; left clues behind for those who would listen.
secrets: He was partially awakened—bloodline unknown, possibly celestial or angelic.
His body was used as the anchor point for the daemon summoning ritual.
His ghost may linger if the ritual succeeds, seeking vengeance or peace.
He left coded notes in his apartment about sewer tunnel locations.
plot_hooks: His dog tags contain a ritual ward etched into the metal—possibly protection given by someone who knew.
His apartment hides coded notes about sewer tunnels and cult meeting locations.
Flashbacks, visions, or ghostly manifestations may reveal his last moments to PCs.
Detective Marlowe feels guilty about failing to protect him and will help PCs investigate.
quotes: [From his journal] 'Something's wrong in the city. People changing. I've seen it before—in the war, in the camps. This time I won't run.'
[From witness accounts] 'Frank was always helping people. Donated to the shelter, fixed cars for free. Good man.'
[Possible ghost manifestation] 'Stop... them... tunnels... beneath... the warehouse...'

npcs.name: Colonel Marcus Reeves
npcs.description: Late 40s, crew cut graying at temples, ramrod posture, carries himself like career military because he is. Fought in WWII, seen things that can't be explained by standard doctrine.
npcs.personality: Pragmatic, disciplined, sees supernaturals as enemy combatants. Not cruel—just coldly tactical. 'Threats must be contained.' Will honor deals but always plans for betrayal.
quotes: I've seen what happens when you let these things run loose. Dresden. Manila. Not on my watch.
You want to help? Fine. But the moment you become the problem, I put you down.
Sentiment is a luxury we can't afford.

npcs.name: Sister Catherine Moreau
npcs.description: Early 30s, nun's habit with combat boots visible underneath, rosary wrapped around one hand, old burn scars on the other. French-Algerian accent. Eyes that have seen demons and still believe in grace.
npcs.personality: Compassionate but zealous. Genuinely wants to save souls—including monsters'. But 'saving' might mean death if redemption fails. Will offer mercy once. Only once.
quotes: God does not abandon His children—even those touched by darkness.
You have been given a gift. The question is: will you use it for His glory or your damnation?
I have cast out demons from cathedrals. Do not test my faith.

npcs.name: Agent Harrison Webb
npcs.description: Mid-30s, forgettable face, suits that blend into any setting, always has an earpiece. Ex-OSS, transitioned to this new 'specialized' division. Knows more than he says.
npcs.personality: Cold War pragmatist. Everything is an asset or a threat. Personally? He's tired. Knows the job is dirty. Does it anyway because someone has to. Will betray PCs if national security demands it.
quotes: Patriotism isn't about flags and parades. It's about making hard choices so civilians don't have to.
The Soviets already have three operational psychic units. We're behind.
I don't need you to like me. I need you to not screw up.

npcs.name: Dr. Solomon Grey (The Architect)
npcs.description: Late 50s, once handsome but now scarred from ritual burns. Expensive suit under ritual robes. Speaks with calm certainty of a true believer. Eyes glow faintly amber when channeling power.
npcs.personality: Visionary zealot. Believes he's saving humanity by forcing evolution. Not sadistic—clinical. Sees casualties as necessary. Genuinely thinks PCs should thank him. Charismatic enough that some do.
npcs.backstory: Manhattan Project scientist. Witnessed Trinity test. Became obsessed with idea that supernatural power could prevent nuclear annihilation. Decades of research led here.

combat_stats.special: Can channel awakened individuals' powers. Each awakened in range adds +1 die to his pools.

quotes: I stood at Alamogordo and watched man become god. Now I offer you the same transcendence.
Your squeamishness is evolutionary deadweight. Adapt or perish.
They called Oppenheimer a monster too. History will vindicate us both.

npcs.name: Elias Thorne
npcs.description: Early 60s, silver-haired, three-piece suits, walks with cane (doesn't need it—affectation). Smokes Turkish cigarettes. Ageless quality to his eyes.
npcs.personality: Weary immortal. Seen too many cycles of this. Wants to guide new generation without controlling them. Cryptic but not malicious. Will help but won't fight your battles.
npcs.backstory: Awakened in 1920s. Worked for Black Chamber's predecessor. Went rogue in 1945 after seeing Hiroshima. Now operates underground railroad for rogue supernaturals.
quotes: This isn't the first 'awakening' I've witnessed. They all think they're special.
The factions aren't your enemies—they're symptoms of a deeper disease.
I can teach you to survive what's coming. I can't teach you why.

npcs.name: Detective Lou Ferraro
npcs.description: Late 50s, rumpled coat, permanent coffee stain on tie, eyes that have seen department corruption. Two years from retirement but gets pulled into supernatural cases.
npcs.personality: Skeptical cop turned reluctant believer. Wants to help but bound by law and bureaucracy. Can be valuable ally or frustrated obstacle depending on how PCs approach.
quotes: I don't care what you are. You commit murder, I arrest you. Simple as that.
Twenty-three years on the force. Never seen anything like this until last month.
Whatever you're into, keep it away from my city.

locations.name: The Alley Behind Velvet Room Jazz Club
locations.description: Narrow cobblestone alley, rain-slicked, lit by one flickering neon sign. Dumpsters provide cover. Fire escape leads to rooftops. Where the first victim was found.
locations.atmosphere: Noir film come to life. Saxophone music drifts from club. Cigarette smoke. Shadows pool unnaturally deep.
locations.secrets: Demon claw marks on brick if you know what to look for. Hidden cult symbol scratched near ground level.

locations.name: The Sewer Network
locations.description: Victorian-era brick tunnels, newer concrete sections, steam pipes running overhead. Water ankle-to-waist deep depending on section. Echoes carry for hundreds of feet.
locations.atmosphere: Claustrophobic darkness. Dripping water constant metronome. Rats scatter. Something larger moves in the distance.
locations.hazards: Flooding during heavy rain. Toxic fumes in some sections. Cultist patrols. Daemon feeding grounds.
locations.map_features: Junction Alpha (main ritual chamber). Maintenance Hub 7 (Ashwood observation post). Drain 13 (cult escape route).

locations.name: St. Michael's Cathedral
locations.description: Gothic revival architecture, stained glass depicting angel/demon battles. Basement converted to Covenant operations center. Bell tower has sniper position.
locations.atmosphere: Sacred but militarized. Incense mingles with gun oil. Prayers and tactical radio chatter.
locations.secrets: Hidden armory of consecrated weapons. Ancient texts in restricted section. Vampire remains in basement reliquary.

locations.name: The Waterfront Industrial Complex
locations.description: Abandoned during Depression, partially repurposed during war, now derelict again. Rusted machinery. Broken windows. Central warehouse converted to ritual site.
locations.atmosphere: Desolation and unnatural energy. Fog that doesn't behave right. Temperature drops. Reality feels thin here.
locations.finale_features: 13 ritual circles. Central platform. Loading bay doors (faction insertion points). Catwalk above. Chemical storage (explosive).

locations.name: Black Chamber Safe House
locations.description: Unmarked building, government plates on vehicles, armed guards in civilian clothes. Basement interrogation rooms. Radio antenna on roof.
locations.atmosphere: Cold War paranoia incarnate. Fluorescent lights. Metal furniture. Watching eyes.
locations.secrets: Holding cells for captured supernaturals. Files on PCs already started. Direct line to Washington.

locations.name: Elias Thorne's Safehouse
locations.description: Speakeasy-turned-occult-library. Hidden entrance behind false wall. Shelves of ancient texts. Maps showing ley lines. Comfortable but secured.
locations.atmosphere: Gentleman's study meets arcane workshop. Safe haven. Outside world feels distant.
locations.resources: Research materials (+2 dice to Occult checks). Emergency escape routes. Warded against scrying.

handouts.title: New Crescent City Map
handouts.content: Map of the city showing major districts and locations. The Theater District, Waterfront, and Industrial Quarter are highlighted as areas of supernatural activity. Keep this handy for reference during the investigation.

handouts.title: Waterfront Warehouse Floor Plan
handouts.content: Detailed floor plan of the abandoned warehouse at the waterfront. Three levels: ground floor (loading docks), second floor (offices), and basement (where cult activity has been reported). Multiple entry points and several rooms of interest.

handouts.title: Newspaper Clipping
handouts.content: VETERAN FOUND DEAD IN ALLEY - Police baffled by brutal slaying. Decorated war hero Thomas McKenna found deceased behind Velvet Room. Autopsy pending. Detective Ferraro asks witnesses to come forward.

handouts.title: Cult Symbol
handouts.content: Three-pointed star within circle. Points labeled (in Latin): Corpus, Anima, Daemon. Translation: Body, Soul, Demon. Symbol of forced transformation ritual.

handouts.title: Architect's Letter (found in Session 3)
handouts.content: To my devoted: The Sleepers stir. Our sacrifices bear fruit. Thirteen circles. New moon. The chosen will rise. The weak will perish. This is mercy. - S.G.

handouts.title: Ashwood Briefing Document
handouts.content: CLASSIFICATION: OBSIDIAN. Codename: AWAKENING PROTOCOL. Confirmed supernatural activity: +300% last 30 days. Recommend containment operations. Congressional oversight suspended per Emergency Directive 7.

handouts.title: Black Chamber Intercept
handouts.content: Encrypted transmission (partially decoded): SOVIET ASSET CONFIRMED IN CITY. OPERATION RED STAR ACTIVE. COUNTER-MEASURES AUTHORIZED. ALL AWAKENED SUBJECTS TO BE SECURED OR NEUTRALIZED.

random_events.event: Street lights flicker and die. Something moves in the darkness.
random_events.effect: Stealth check to avoid random encounter with Lesser Shade.

random_events.event: Ashwood patrol passes nearby. Military vehicles, searchlights.
random_events.effect: Hide or talk your way past. Getting detained wastes time.

random_events.event: Psychic flashback: see victim's final moments.
random_events.effect: Gain clue but suffer -1 die next roll from trauma.

random_events.event: Meet another awakened individual, scared and hiding.
random_events.effect: Potential ally or liability. Choice: help or ignore.

random_events.event: Cult graffiti appears on walls—watching you.
random_events.effect: Intimidation check or suffer -1 die to Willpower rolls from paranoia.

random_events.event: Faction contact offers intel in exchange for favor.

rewards.name: Consecrated Revolver
rewards.stats: d8 damage, counts as holy weapon against demons and undead
rewards.description: Silver-plated .38, blessed by Sister Catherine. Bullets engraved with prayers.

rewards.name: Blood-Etched Dog Tags
rewards.effect: Once per session, ignore one Moderate wound
rewards.description: Military dog tags inscribed with protective runes. Warm to touch.

rewards.name: Ritual Chalk
rewards.effect: Reroll one failed Occult check per session
rewards.description: White chalk infused with ground bone and silver. Used for protective circles.

rewards.name: Ashwood Combat Knife
rewards.description: Tactical knife with silver edge. Foundation issue. Traceable back to them.

rewards.name: The Architect's Grimoire
rewards.effect: +2 dice to Ritual magic, but each use risks corruption (Soul check)
rewards.description: Leather-bound journal filled with Solomon Grey's research. Pages whisper.

rewards.name: Black Chamber Credentials
rewards.effect: Government authority when flashed. Draws attention from Agency.
rewards.description: Fake but functional ID and badge. 'Consultant' status. Use carefully.

gm_guidance.tone: This module should feel like a noir detective story colliding with supernatural horror. Think True Detective season 1 meets Constantine. Rain, shadows, cigarettes, moral ambiguity, and cosmic dread.
gm_guidance.pacing: Sessions 1-2 are investigation and discovery. Session 3 escalates to action. Session 4 is choice-driven roleplay. Session 5 is climactic set-piece. Adjust if group prefers different balance.
gm_guidance.faction_balance: No faction is purely good or evil. Ashwood protects humanity but treats supernaturals as monsters. Covenant saves souls but through zealotry. Black Chamber serves nation but through exploitation. Let players debate which is 'right.'
gm_guidance.player_agency: The Awakening can end five different ways based on player choice. Don't railroad to one outcome. Each is valid and sets up different campaign styles.
gm_guidance.horror_elements: Use body horror (daemon feeding), cosmic horror (reality tearing), and psychological horror (forced awakening trauma). Balance with heroic moments so players feel empowered, not helpless.
gm_guidance.adaptation: Module is flexible. Set in any post-WWII American city. Swap factions if needed. Scale encounters for party size. Add or remove sessions based on campaign length.
gm_guidance.failure_states: If PCs die or fail catastrophically, don't end campaign. Have faction recruit them as revenants/ghosts, or start new characters investigating the PCs' disappearance.

difficulty_scaling.easy_mode: Reduce enemy wound thresholds by 1. Give PCs extra starting gear. Faction backup arrives sooner.
difficulty_scaling.hard_mode: Add more minions. Architect has 10 wounds. Time pressure: ritual succeeds in 5 rounds instead of 10.
difficulty_scaling.nightmare_mode: All three factions hostile. PCs hunted by everyone. No safe havens.

alternate_hooks.military: PCs are Army investigators looking into fragging incident that was actually daemon attack.
alternate_hooks.civilian: PCs are journalists investigating missing persons story.
alternate_hooks.criminal: PCs are mob enforcers who discover supernatural threat to their territory.

sequel_hooks: Architect's grimoire contains prophecy of greater threat.
Soviet Operation Red Star agents arrive seeking revenge.
One PC's bloodline has unique, world-shaking destiny.
Ritual partially succeeded—13 new awakened need guidance.
Faction war erupts. PCs caught in middle.
